EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - - Clean DocumentEmail false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi Dan, Following up on the email below, I was hoping you might have some time over the next few weeks for a 30 minute discussion around how Turbonomic allows for our customers to save as they invest more in AWS and other public cloud providers while still trying to optimize their on premise infrastructure. Typically, organizations looking into a hybrid cloud infrastructure face three very difficult questions: · Which workloads should be burst to the public cloud?· When should we burst them?· When should we bring them back and where should we place them? Turbonomic’s economic abstraction answers all these questions and makes performance-cost driven placement sizing and auto-scaling decisions across all clouds. With Turbonomic you are enabled to extend your private cloud management approach to: · Burst workload into the cloud when demand increases and cannot be met with local resources· Maintain control on workload performance and resource utilization to decide when to move workloads back on-premises · Allow applications to auto-scale and clone into the cloud · Load balance across private and public clouds EDF Delivers the Hybrid Cloud <[[https://turbonomic.com/resources/videos/turbonomic-customer-success-story-edf-re-delivering-cloud/]]> Dan, do you have 30 minutes for my team and I to provide an introduction/educational overview to Turbonomic and see where we can align with you and the team at the Advisory Board Company? Best, James Wilcox Turbonomic <[[https://turbonomic.com/product/#lower-infrastructure-costs]]>C: (508) 479 7516 Email: james.wilcox@turbonomic.com <[[mailto:james.wilcox@turbonomic.com]]> From: James Wilcox Sent: Tuesday, April 25, 2017 8:15 AM To: 'holohand@advisory.com' <holohand@advisory.com> Subject: Dan - Controlling costs of both on premise and public cloud investments Dan – With a hybrid cloud environment I know it can be difficult to not overspend on template sizes for the public cloud while still trying to maintain and optimize an on premise infrastructure as well. It’s a lot to manage. As you know, with all the SAAS offerings that The Advisory Board Company offers to its customers, it is important to be agile and you must be able to spin up VMs quickly to the DevOps team which is why I assume you and the team chose to go with AWS to support the non-legacy applications. What I’d like to show you is how Turbonomic allows for our customers to spend less on template sizing in the cloud, while still assuring the performance and increasing the efficiency of their on-premise environment.
